intro: Faramea lutzeana, commonly known as the African evergreen or African holly, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, including countries like Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Faramea lutzeana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forest understories or along stream banks.
